results.title: Through the eyes of Forrest Gump
results.creator_credit: Peyton Reed, William Rus and Paramount Pictures
results.brief_description: ‘Forest Gump’ won audiences over with it’s universal theme of the underdog who triumphs in the face of adversity, carefully intercut with definitive moments in American history. This program provides a behind the scenes look at how director Robert Zemeckis and his team of special effects artist created the illusion of past and present meeting - such as when Forest meets several U.S. presidents, as well as the special effects involved in recreating the anti-war demonstration, the ping pong game, Lt. Dan’s amputated body and the hurricane. Interviews are provided with cast members Tom Hanks, Robin Wright, Gary Sinise, Mykelti Williamson, Sally Field and Michael Humphreys.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Peyton Reed, William Rus and Paramount Pictures

results.title: Through the eyes of a child (TEFC)
results.brief_description: A shopping expedition seen from a child’s eye level. The mother’s goal is just to shop but the child wants to savour every experience along the way, unaware of the circumstances which make his mother hurry on.
results.description: A shopping expedition seen from a child’s eye level. The mother’s goal is just to shop but the child wants to savour every experience along the way, unaware of the circumstances which make his mother hurry on.

results.title: Through my eyes: Stradbroke Primary School, South Australia (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Donald Crombie, Timothy Read and Film Australia
results.brief_description: Aims to show how open plan school design and method offers greater scope for flexibility in teaching approaches at the infants school level. Designed primarily for in-service use by informed teacher audiences.

results.title: Through my eyes: Kilkenny Primary School, South Australia
results.creator_credit: Donald Crombie, Timothy Read and Film Australia
results.brief_description: Kilkenny Primary School is an open-plan school in Adelaide. A bright decor with red carpets, a straw covered ceiling, and splashes of bright colors provides the setting for the activities of senior primary pupils and their teachers. The implementation of a team teaching approach, individual and group work, and the integration of activities and ideas are illustrated in the film. (Teacher education)

results.title: Through different eyes
results.brief_description: Melbourne is the headquarters for many multinational companies, and because of its strategic position has the busiest seaport in Australia. With the Victorian Government offering worthwhile assistance to suitable potential migrants, more and more overseas business people recognising the potential opportunities available, are opting to move to this state. Three such men, Alan Ang (Singapore), Heinz Karona (Germany) and Dr Robert Deutcher (USA) discuss the assistance offered by the Victorian Government, climate, education, quality of life, cost of living, as some of the reasons determining the decision to migrate.

results.title: Through a looking glass: a film on drama
results.creator_credit: Vincent O'Donnell and Victorian Film Corporation
results.brief_description: A Drama in Education teaching film using Year 7 students who had been involved with classes in improvisation and role play. The performances were not directed for the camera.

results.title: Through a broken pane
results.creator_credit: Blake James, Wolf Koenig and ONF | NFB
results.brief_description: From an artist’s sketchbook and a poet’s memories, a recollection of life in a country school, a place now derelict and vacant but alive with past associations. The film employs various forms of animation to give life and activity to the old building, looking in through the broken windows at the old desks, the clock on the wall, and looking out at the countryside and what a child might remember of what happened there.
